[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [VM] [Resource safety violation] Can Metadata manipulation bypass Move's resource safety guarantees, allowing double-spending of resources or resource duplication? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [VM] [Type safety bypass] Can crafted Metadata with malformed type information cause type safety violations in the Move VM, allowing illegal type casts or memory corruption? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Attributes] [View function bypass] Can attackers craft Metadata with view function attributes on non-view functions, bypassing state immutability checks and allowing unauthorized state modifications? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Attributes] [Resource group manipulation] Can malicious Metadata with resource_group attributes cause incorrect resource grouping, leading to resource access violations or fund theft? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Attributes] [Event spoofing] Can crafted event attributes in Metadata allow attackers to spoof system events, manipulating off-chain indexers and causing incorrect balance displays? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Attributes] [Randomness manipulation] Can false randomness attributes in Metadata bypass unbiasability checks, allowing attackers to predict or manipulate on-chain randomness? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Attributes] [Unknown attribute] Can future attribute types (unknown to current validators) in Metadata cause validation failures, preventing legitimate module upgrades? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Cache] [Cache coherence] Can race conditions in thread-local V1_METADATA_CACHE access cause different threads to see inconsistent Metadata for the same module during parallel transaction execution? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Cache] [Cache overflow] Can attackers force cache eviction of legitimate Metadata by publishing many modules, causing performance degradation and increased latency? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Cache] [Cache invalidation] Is there proper cache invalidation when modules are upgraded, or can stale Metadata persist in caches causing incorrect execution? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Concurrency] [Data race] Can concurrent access to Metadata during parallel module loading cause data races if the struct is shared without proper synchronization? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Concurrency] [TOCTOU] Can time-of-check-time-of-use races occur between metadata validation and metadata use, allowing invalid metadata to be executed? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Errors] [Error map injection] Can attackers inject malicious error_map entries in Metadata to display misleading error messages, facilitating social engineering attacks? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Errors] [Error code collision] Can crafted error codes in Metadata error_map collide with system error codes, causing incorrect error reporting and debugging difficulties? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Errors] [Error message DoS] Can extremely long error descriptions in Metadata cause log flooding or string processing DoS when errors are displayed? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Compilation] [Compiler version spoofing] Can attackers craft COMPILATION_METADATA_KEY entries with false compiler versions to bypass unstable bytecode checks on mainnet? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Compilation] [Language version manipulation] Can manipulated language version in compilation metadata cause modules to be executed with wrong VM semantics, leading to security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Compilation] [Build info injection] Can attackers inject malicious build information in compilation metadata to exploit downstream tools or indexers? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Compatibility] [Version downgrade] Can attackers publish modules with future Metadata versions that break backward compatibility, causing older validators to reject valid blocks? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Compatibility] [Upgrade path] Is there a safe upgrade path for Metadata format changes, or could hard forks be required if fundamental issues are discovered? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Compatibility] [Unknown field handling] How are unknown fields in future Metadata versions handled - are they silently ignored (dangerous) or explicitly rejected (breaks forward compatibility)? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Edge case] [Empty metadata] Can modules with empty metadata Vec (no entries) cause null pointer or index out-of-bounds errors in find_metadata() or iteration logic? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Edge case] [All-zero bytes] Can metadata with all-zero byte keys or values exploit assumptions about null termination or string processing in downstream code? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Edge case] [Maximum size] What happens when Metadata reaches Vec<u8> maximum capacity (isize::MAX) - are there proper error handling and bounds checks? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-core/types/src/metadata.rs] [Edge case] [Unicode edge cases] Can metadata keys containing special Unicode characters (e.g., null, RTL overrides, invisible characters) bypass key matching logic? (Low)
